summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from September 23, 2020, covering a wide range of national and international news. It includes a section noting a judge kept alive an effort to unseal FBI files on Jeffrey Epstein, and mentions Bill Clinton dining with Ghislaine Maxwell in 2014. The bulk of the document covers other criminal investigations, counter-terrorism, political news, and the COVID-19 pandemic.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Disgraced financier, subject of FBI files
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a public records lawsuit seeking to unseal FBI documents about him, including his time as a government informant.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Reported to have dined with Bill Clinton in 2014; accused of procuring underage girls for Epstein.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Reported to have dined with Ghislaine Maxwell in 2014.

persons.name: Angela Clemente
persons.context: Sued in May 2020 to force the FBI to release documents about Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Trevor N. McFadden
persons.context: Presided over Angela Clemente's public-records lawsuit against the FBI regarding Epstein documents.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Quoted regarding a worldwide opioid bust and mentioned in a letter from House Republicans about investigating riot funding.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Announced takedown of a drug trafficking ring under Operation LeGend.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned extensively in political news, including Supreme Court nomination plans, UN address, and pandemic response.

persons.name: Vladimir Putin
persons.context: CIA assessment found he is most likely directing election influence efforts to support President Trump.

persons.name: Andriy Derkach
persons.context: Identified as a Russian agent disseminating anti-Biden information, per CIA assessment.

persons.name: Pascale Ferrier
persons.context: Canadian woman charged with threatening President Trump for allegedly mailing a ricin-laced letter.

persons.name: Baimadajie Angwang
persons.context: Charged with being an 'intelligence asset' for the Chinese government.

persons.name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
persons.context: Photographed sitting next to Officer Baimadajie Angwang at a Tibetan New Year party.

persons.name: Julian Assange
persons.context: Psychiatric expert testified he is a 'very high' suicide risk if extradited to the U.S.

persons.name: Jerry Harris
persons.context: FBI investigating over child pornography charges; 'Cheer' actor.

persons.name: Mossimo Giannulli
persons.context: Sentenced to five months imprisonment over college bribery scandal.

persons.name: Mike Pence
persons.context: Made comments on vaccine confidence and criticized Biden; Air Force Two hit a bird.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Mentioned in political coverage, including CIA assessment of Russian efforts to denigrate him.

persons.name: Nancy Pelosi
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to stopgap spending bill and analysis of relationship with Trump.

persons.name: Mitt Romney
persons.context: Announced support for moving forward with a Supreme Court nomination vote.

persons.name: Amy Coney Barrett
persons.context: Reported as a top contender for Supreme Court nomination; membership in People of Praise group discussed.

persons.name: Barbara Lagoa
persons.context: Reported as a top contender for Supreme Court nomination.

persons.name: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
persons.context: Recent death; replacement process is a major news topic.

persons.name: Anthony Fauci
persons.context: Quoted on pandemic death toll; former NIH official published misinformation about him.

persons.name: Kayleigh McEnany
persons.context: Rebuked CNN's Jim Acosta and defended Trump's pandemic response.

persons.name: Mike Pompeo
persons.context: Predicted European cooperation on Iran arms embargo; seeking UN support to redefine human rights.

persons.name: Xi Jinping
persons.context: Addressed UN General Assembly; vowed China will achieve 'carbon neutrality' before 2060.

connections.description: Maxwell is accused of procuring underage girls for sex-trafficker Epstein.
Reported to have dined together in 2014.
CIA assessment indicates Putin is likely directing Derkach's efforts to disseminate anti-Biden information.
CIA assessment found Putin is likely directing influence operations to support Trump's re-election.
Photographed sitting next to each other at a Tibetan New Year party.
Clemente sued to force the FBI to release documents about Epstein.

events.title: FBI News Briefing Published
events.description: Daily FBI Public Affairs News Briefing covering leading news, protests, counter-terrorism, criminal investigations, and other topics.

events.title: Judge Allows Epstein Records Lawsuit to Continue
events.description: U.S. District Judge Trevor N. McFadden allowed Angela Clemente's public-records lawsuit against the FBI to force the release of documents about Jeffrey Epstein to continue.

events.title: Bill Clinton Dines with Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Bill Clinton attended an intimate dinner with friends that included Ghislaine Maxwell after a gala in Los Angeles.

events.title: Worldwide Opioid Bust 'DisrupTor'
events.description: DOJ and Europol announced nearly 200 arrests and $6.5 million seized in a worldwide crackdown on opioid trafficking on the darknet.

events.title: Ricin Letter to President Trump Intercepted
events.description: A ricin-laced letter addressed to President Trump was intercepted at a White House mail facility. Canadian woman Pascale Ferrier was charged.

events.title: CIA Assessment on Russian Election Interference
events.description: A CIA analysis concluded Russian President Vladimir Putin is most likely directing interference operations aimed at supporting President Trump's re-election.

events.title: U.S. Death Toll from COVID-19 Tops 200,000
events.description: The U.S. death toll from the coronavirus surpassed 200,000, a major milestone in the pandemic.

events.title: Senator Romney Supports SCOTUS Nomination Vote
events.description: Senator Mitt Romney announced he would support holding a vote on President Trump's Supreme Court nominee, likely giving Republicans the votes needed to proceed.

keyFacts: A federal judge kept alive a public records lawsuit seeking to force the FBI to release tens of thousands of documents about Jeffrey Epstein, including his time as a government informant.
The news briefing reports that Bill Clinton dined with Ghislaine Maxwell in 2014, according to information obtained by The Daily Beast.

A CIA assessment concluded with moderate confidence that Russian President Vladimir Putin is most likely directing influence operations aimed at denigrating Joe Biden and supporting President Trump's re-election.
The U.S. death toll from COVID-19 surpassed 200,000 on September 22, 2020.

Senator Mitt Romney announced he would support a Senate vote on President Trump's Supreme Court nominee, likely securing the necessary Republican votes to proceed with confirmation before the election.
